Start Date: 2025, April

Creative Operations, Associate

Identify and establish standard operating procedures for Ops, Creative and Marketing teams to inform cross-functional collaboration.

1-3 years of professional transferrable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience

Strong verbal and written skills including distilling data into compelling, insight-led presentations
Superb project management skills including the ability to work on multiple projects at once
Balance strong analytical skills with effective communication
Critical thinking, including the ability to break down complex ideas and generate insights and solutions or strategically build a story from large data sets

Collaborative attitude that thrives as part of a team
High attention to detail and proven ability to consider multiple priorities simultaneously
An ownership mindset with the ability to streamline processes and thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment with a get stuff done attitude
Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement and learning, working through ambiguity in an evolving organization

Title: Specialist, Retail Operations
RoleDescription:
Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops
$19/hour
Location: Wilmette, IL
Overview:
As a Logistics and Inventory Specialist, youll play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations as Wayfair's Physical Retail team reimagines the shopping experience. From managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, your work will directly support an exceptional customer shopping experience. With a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving, this role will focus on maintaining inventory accuracy, resolving logistical exceptions, and optimizing efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, collaborates effectively with partner teams, and is passionate about owning and creating a flawless operational foundation reflecting Wayfairs commitment to a top-tier experience and retail excellence.
 
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Specialist Do?

Demonstrates Reliability: Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This helps ensure we're ready and available to help our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Perform daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to safeguard the integrity and accuracy of inventory records. Leverage scan technology to document carton-level details like condition, quantity, and location.
Manage Inventory Performance: Monitor aging inventory, process markdowns, and execute damage write-offs to maintain accuracy and efficiency. Handle vendor returns for recalls, dead stock, and overstock inventory while leveraging experience in inventory management or e-commerce to optimize processes.
Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inventory with care, including the manual handling of large and heavy goods. Ensure all inventory is processed correctly, capturing detailed records of overages, shortages, or damages.
Proactively Monitor Systems: Use order management tools and Warehouse Management Software to track inventory movement, troubleshoot discrepancies, and maintain up-to-date records. Regularly review Cycle Count data using Google Sheets to identify and address gaps.
Audit Operations: Conduct regular and triggered audits for inbound and outbound trucks to ensure accurate processing and shipment flow.
Support Operational Excellence: Use a ticketing system to manage exceptions, resolve issues, and provide input on improving existing processes and tools based on your day-to-day experience.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with logistics leaders and other teams to streamline operations, share insights, and uphold Wayfairs commitment to operational excellence.
Adapt and Problem-Solve: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by taking ownership of inventory challenges, driving solutions, and ensuring smooth coordination between warehouse and retail operations.

 
What are the Job Requirements?
 
Education: High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
Inventory Control Experience: 1 to 3 years of inventory control experience, preferably in a retail environment, is required.
Distribution or Logistics Experience: 1+ year of experience in distribution or logistics is preferred.
Open Schedule Availability: You may be required to work a flexible schedule that in many cases may include nights, weekends, and holidays.
Customer Service Skills: Must possess excellent customer service skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Adaptability and Problem-Solving: Demonstrates the ability to adapt to evolving tools, systems, and processes to ensure operational excellence.
Technical Proficiency: Strong computer skills with experience in Microsoft Office or Google Suite are preferred.
Detail Orientation: Must be highly detail-oriented and organized, with a proven ability to manage complex inventory systems and workflows.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

Physical Demands

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Working Environment

Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
Occasional noise and vibrations
Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

Title: Paid Social Marketing
RoleDescription:
Salary: Competitive salary + equity scheme eligibility 
Location: London Office Based EC1V 7LQ
Working Hours: 9am-6pm (Monday-Friday)
Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership,  Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays,  Pension, Cycle to Work scheme amongst others.
Drive growth. Lead strategy. Own Paid Social at scale.
Paid Social Manager! Take the lead on Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, owning our strategy, scale performance, and managing multi-million-dollar budgetsall while guiding a high-impact team to Paid Social success.
Youll own the end-to-end strategy, execution, and optimization of campaigns, bringing deep channel expertise and a data-first mindset to every decision. This role is the perfect challenge for a results-oriented marketer who thrives on innovation, understands the evolving privacy landscape, and can balance creative testing with technical rigor to deliver strong business outcomes.
What Youll Do

Oversee and manage the Paid Social program across Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, ensuring a unified and high-performing strategy.
Lead a team of analysts to drive performance, optimize budgets, and scale campaigns efficiently.
Manage multi-million-dollar budgets, ensuring spend allocation is optimized for ROAS, LTV, and incremental revenue growth.
Develop and implement audience segmentation, bidding strategies, and creative testing frameworks to improve performance.
Partner with Creative teams to develop and test new ad formats, messaging strategies, and landing page experiences.
Collaborate with Martech, Data Science, and Engineering to refine measurement models, attribution frameworks, and incrementality testing.
Stay ahead of platform changes, privacy regulations, and measurement challenges, including iOS updates, cookieless tracking, server-side measurement, GA4, and first-party data utilization.
Build and nurture relationships with Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok account teams to ensure best-in-class execution and early access to new features.
Develop dashboards and reporting frameworks to provide leadership with clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Drive continuous improvement in automation, campaign efficiency, and performance measurement.

What Youll Need

Proven experience in Paid Social, Performance Marketing, or Digital Advertising.
Demonstrable people management experience, someone who nurtures, motivates and inspires individuals and teams.
A track record of driving growth and efficiency through large-scale Paid Social campaigns across Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok.
Strong analytical and technical skills, with expertise in SQL and Excel (advanced functions, automation, pivot tables). Any knowledge of Python, R, Looker, Tableau is a plus.
Deep understanding of bidding strategies, auction dynamics, audience targeting, and conversion rate optimization.
Display knowledge & capability of A/B testing, creative iteration, and landing page optimization.
Strong commercial mindset, with the ability to identify growth opportunities and optimize campaign spend for efficiency and scale.
Expertise in the evolving privacy and measurement landscape, including GA4, server-side tracking, first-party data, and attribution challenges.
Excellent stakeholder management skills, with experience presenting insights and influencing senior leadership.

Advanced Excel Skills

Title: Head of Global HR Shared Services
RoleDescription:
About the Team:
The Employee Resource Center (ERC) is Wayfair's global HR shared service center. The team is central to our Talent teams transformation from a decentralized model to a tiered service delivery model. This evolution aims to deliver significant improvements in service quality, customer satisfaction, compliance, and efficiency across Wayfair. The ERC focuses on streamlining processes, enhancing service quality through centralization and automation, managing an offshore program, and leveraging technology like GenAI to drive excellent operations and employee experience.
About the Role:
We are seeking a strategic and experienced leader to be the Head of the Employee Resource Center (ERC). This is a critical global role based in Boston, responsible for leading the ERC team and driving the ongoing transformation of Wayfair's HR service delivery. You will oversee a global team and be responsible for setting the strategic direction, managing operations, and ensuring the successful implementation of key initiatives like knowledge management and the application of generative and agentic AI to the talent processes. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the employee experience and driving operational excellence within the Talent organization.
What You'll Do:

Strategic Leadership: Lead the transformation to a tiered service delivery model, setting the vision and strategy to enhance quality, compliance, and efficiency.
Talent Leadership Partnership: Develop strong, collaborative working relationships with the Talent leadership team including the CPO to understand needs, align on priorities, and jointly drive a strategic agenda for HR service delivery transformation and operations.
Operational Management: Oversee the operations of the global ERC team, ensuring consistent service delivery and achievement of key performance indicators (KPIs) related to service levels (SLAs), time-to-resolution (TTR), and customer satisfaction (NPS).
Process Improvement & Centralization: Drive the continuous improvement, standardization, and centralization of Talent processes into the ERC, identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency gains. Oversee the absorption of additional Talent workstreams.
Tech Innovation: Thinking AI-first, lead the strategy and implementation of new technologies, including generative and agentic AI. Have a strong handle on evolving options in the market, lead RFPs and evaluate options, decide whether to build vs. buy, and ultimately implement AI-driven solutions, ensuring accuracy, strong customer experience, compliance and security. Additionally, work with the Tech team to optimize our Workday configuration, and ensure strong knowledge management and ticketing functionality.
Team Leadership & Development: Manage and develop a global team of Talent Ops professionals, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and customer focus.
Vendor & Offshore Management: Oversee relationships with external vendors, including the offshore service provider (OSL), ensuring performance standards are met, and scale the program effectively.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner closely with leaders across Talent (including HRIS, Total Rewards, Talent Business Partners), Tech, Finance, and other departments to align on priorities, manage dependencies, and ensure successful execution of ERC initiatives.
Reporting & Analytics: Oversee the development and automation of operational and customer experience reporting and capacity modeling to track performance, identify trends, and inform strategic decisions. Ensure key metrics are centralized and accessible.
Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks associated with ERC operations and strategic initiatives, particularly concerning technology dependencies and implementation complexities.

What You'll Need:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
Significant experience (typically 15+ years) in HR operations, shared services, or a similar environment.
Proven track record of leading large-scale transformations and process improvement initiatives within an HR or other business function.
Strong understanding of HR service delivery models, technologies (including HRIS like Workday, case management like ServiceNow, and AI/Chatbots), and best practices.
Demonstrated experience in managing successful vendor relationships, including offshore partners.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use data to drive decisions.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Exceptional communication, influencing, and stakeholder management abilities.
10+ years of experience leading large global teams (40+) and experience leading managers.
